subject: Real Estate
title: Leverage: The Amplifier of Ruin
description: A fast breakdown of Leverage: The Amplifier of Ruin for builders.

hook.text: You put $20,000 down on a $200,000 house. That's 10:1 leverage. A 10% drop wipes you out.

buildup.text: Leverage multiplies gains on the way up. A 10% price rise doubles your investment.

discovery.text: But leverage works both ways. The same 10% decline erases 100% of your equity.

twist.text: In 2008, some investors were leveraged 30:1. A 3% drop made them insolvent.

climax.text: Leverage is why property bubbles cause systemic crises â€” the losses cascade through the banking system.

punchline.text: Leverage makes you rich slowly and poor instantly.

quiz.question: What happens to a 10:1 leveraged investor if property drops 10%?
